name: Deduce
bullets: A proof assistant used for teaching correctness proofs of functional programs to students.
I have worked on developing the [website](https://jsiek.github.io/deduce/), general functionality and the [emacs package](https://github.com/mateidragony/deduce-mode)

name: Mega Puzzle
bullets: An interconnected puzzle extravanganza inspired by [Mr. Spock](https://github.com/Spoccer) and the [MIT Mystery Hunt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MIT_Mystery_Hunt)
2023 ([site](https://sites.google.com/iu.edu/mega-puzzle)): Q*bert, Sly Spy, Word Zapper and more!
2024 ([site](https://luddy-llc.github.io/MegaPuzzle2024/) [source](https://github.com/Luddy-LLC/MegaPuzzle2024)): Supercoolio's Quest, Musical Bards, Castaway and more!

name: Racket Compiler
bullets: A simple compiler for a subset of Racket. Made as a part of CSCI-P 423 Compilers class at IU.
Made with Racket, by Racket, for Racket.

name: BareOS ðŸ§¸
bullets: A very bare-bones kernel built for RISC-V devices. Made as part of CSCI-P 436 Operating Systems class at IU.
Made with C and RISC-V Assembly.

name: MLispy
bullets: A custom made Lisp based language inspired by [Build your own Lisp](https://buildyourownlisp.com).

name: SuperSmashMateis
bullets: A *very* shoddy recreation of the hit game [Super Smash Bros.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_Smash_Bros.) in Java where you can play as some of my friends and family.
Made with Java and lots of spaghetti code.
